1515</span>

1516</div>

1517</div>

1518</div>

1519</div>

1520</div>

1521</div>

1522</span>

1523</div>

1524<div class="">

1525<div class="styles-plugin-outer custom-outer-style-ROW-ffb-bf-bb-b-eaef">

1526<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-ROW-ffb-bf-bb-b-eaef">

1527<div class="Row-module_global__1T17H merce-row-container">

1528<div class="Layout-module_row__3IzXF merce-row">

1529<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-12__29AUW Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1530<div class="">

1531<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-ebb-bf-d--fdefd">

1532<div class="merce-column-container">

1533<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-SEPARATOR-bbfe-a--d-dafc">

1534<div class="">

1535<hr style="margin:40px 0 40px 0;border-top:1px solid rgba(217,217,217,1)"/>

1536</div>

1537</div>

1538<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-TEXTBLOCK-daca-a--c-ccedacd">

1539<div>

1540<div class=" TextBlock-module_textBlockContainer__X2cPA">

1541<div>

1542<h3 style="text-align: center;">

1543Shop Related Categories</h3>

1544

1545</div>

1546</div>

1547</div>

1548</div>

1549<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-CODE_BLOCK-a-eb--b-fadcc">

1550<div>

1551</div>

1565<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-ROW-eecc-ac-f-ae-fabbb">

1566<div class="Row-module_global__1T17H merce-row-container">

1567<div class="Layout-module_row__3IzXF merce-row">

1584</span>

1585</div>

1586<div class="">

1587<span id="design-resources-row" class="identifier-plugin ">

1588<div class="styles-plugin-outer custom-outer-style-ROW-abb-c-c-acc-adedef">

1590<div class="Row-module_global__1T17H merce-row-container">

1591<div class="Layout-module_row__3IzXF merce-row">

1592<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-12__29AUW Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1593<div class="">

1594<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-bdb-b-bee-ca-edfdcfdeee">

1595<div class="merce-column-container">

1596<span id="design-resources-title" class="identifier-plugin ">

1597<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-TEXTBLOCK-df-c-f-bbe-ceacaef">

1598<div>

1599<div class=" TextBlock-module_textBlockContainer__X2cPA">

1600<div>

1601<h3 style="text-align: center;">

1602Design Resources</h3>

1603

1604</div>

1605</div>

1606</div>

1607</div>

1608</span>

1609<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-CODE_BLOCK-bcec-bc-d-adcd-eef">

1610<div>

1611</div>

1612</div>

1613</div>

1614</div>

1615</div>

1616</div>

1617</div>

1618</div>

1619</div>

1620</div>

1621</span>

1622</div>

1623<div class="">

1624<span id="prod-recs-row" class="identifier-plugin ">

1625<div class="styles-plugin-outer custom-outer-style-ROW-deddf-be-cb-ebb-effe">

1626<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-ROW-deddf-be-cb-ebb-effe">

1627<div class="Row-module_global__1T17H merce-row-container">

1630<div class="">

1631<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-cdbe-e-f-afaa-fafef">

1632<div class="merce-column-container">

1633<span id="prod-rec-carousel" class="identifier-plugin ">

1634<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-RENDER_PROPS--d-f-dbe-feefea">

1635<div style="min-height:400px">

1636</div>

1638</span>

1651<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-ROW-fafd-ab-cde-c-abdcc">

1653<div class="Layout-module_row__3IzXF merce-row">

1655<div class="Layout-module_hidden-xs__2UQIp Layout-module_visible-sm__Z2eD8 Layout-module_visible-md__1t5sZ Layout-module_visible-lg__1PfV6 visibility-plugin-wrapper">

1656<div class="">

1657<span id="related-links-column" class="identifier-plugin ">

1658<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-baa-d-ce-af-afab">

1659<div class="merce-column-container">

1660<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-CODE_BLOCK-cdd-da-f-a-fded">

1661<div>

1662</div>

1663</div>

1664</div>

1665</div>

1666</span>

1667</div>

1668</div>

1669</div>

1670<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-10__EQSoU Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1671<div class="">

1672<span id="seo-and-links-column" class="identifier-plugin ">

1673<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-baefb-ca-d-bf-cdaba">

1674<div class="merce-column-container">

1675<div class="Layout-module_visible-xs__2btQu Layout-module_hidden-sm__hU5SH Layout-module_hidden-md__2BSUe Layout-module_hidden-lg__1bFpH visibility-plugin-wrapper">

1676<span id="related-links-mobile" class="identifier-plugin ">

1677<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-CODE_BLOCK-ed-bf-ef-cee-dceffc">

1678<div>

1679</div>

1680</div>

1681</span>

1682</div>

1683<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-TEXTBLOCK-da-f--f-dfdb">

1684<div>

1685<div class=" TextBlock-module_textBlockContainer__X2cPA">

1686<div>

1687<h2>

1688<strong>

1689Find the Ideal Bathtub&nbsp;</strong>

1690&nbsp;</h2>

1691

1692

1693<p>

1694Vevano Home offers a wide selection of&nbsp;high-quality, stylish bathtubs in various&nbsp;sizes and materials. Whether you&#39;re looking for a timeless cast iron freestanding tub or a sleek modern drop-in, we&#39;ve got you covered. Not sure what tub is best for you? We can help with that too! Here&#39;s everything you need to know about tub sizes, shapes, materials, and more&nbsp;so you can find the ideal tub for your bathroom.</p>

1695

1696

1697<p>

1698&nbsp;</p>

1699

1700

1701<h3>

1702Bathtub Size</h3>

1703

1704

1705<p>

1706Let&rsquo;s start with the size of your bathtub. Some may prefer an above-average length instead of a deeper soaking depth. If you are a tall person that enjoys laying back and relaxing in your tub, you may want to choose a length over depth. Bathtubs come in 4ft, 5ft, and 6ft lengths.</p>

1707

1708

1709<p>

1710On the other hand, if you prefer to have a deeper bathtub, allowing you to emerge yourself in the water fully, you will probably want to prioritize depth over length. Some people also enjoy deeper tubs because their kids or pets can fit inside as well. A standard bathtub measures 14&ndash;20 inches. Whatever you prefer, there is an option for you, and our guide on <a href="https://vevano.com/resource-center/standard-tub-size-measurement-guide/">

1711how to measure a bathtub</a>

1712 can help!</p>

1713

1714

1715<p>

1716&nbsp;</p>

1717

1718

1719<h3>

1720Types of Bathtubs</h3>

1721

1722

1723<p>

1724As you search for a new tub, it helps to understand the five main types of bathtubs&mdash;drop-in, alcove, freestanding, whirlpool, and walk-in bathtubs. All of these bathtubs are very different and have unique features.</p>

1725

1726

1727<p>

1728&nbsp;</p>

1729

1730

1731<h4>

1732<span style="font-size:18px;">

1733<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-drop-in-bathtubs/">

1734Drop-in Bathtub</a>

1735</span>

1736</h4>

1737

1738

1739<p>

1740This particular type of bathtub is your typical rectangular-shaped bathtub with angular lines. Drop-in bathtubs are tubs dropped in a frame or structure, featuring a rim that goes around the top of the tub. You can customize your drop-in bathtub by selecting the material you would like the rim to be made of; most people prefer tile or stone. These bathtubs are ideal for a children&rsquo;s bathroom because of its shape and ease of getting in and out.</p>

1741

1742

1743<p>

1744&nbsp;</p>

1745

1746

1747<h4>

1748<span style="font-size:18px;">

1749<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-tubs-alcove-bathtubs/">

1750Alcove Bathtub</a>

1751</span>

1752</h4>

1753

1754

1755<p>

1756An alcove bathtub is most known to be in the corner of a bathroom and is known for the way it is installed. These beautiful bathtubs are installed into a recess in a bathroom, often against a wall or in the corner. Since these tubs are designed to fit between three furnished walls, it&rsquo;s not uncommon to see a shower curtain on the fourth wall. Alcove tubs and drop-in tubs are very similar; however, alcove tubs require fewer steps during installation.</p>

1757

1758

1759<p>

1760&nbsp;</p>

1761

1762

1763<h4>

1764<span style="font-size:18px;">

1765<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-freestanding-bathtubs/">

1766Freestanding Bathtub</a>

1767</span>

1768</h4>

1769

1770

1771<p>

1772<a href="https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-freestanding-tubs/">

1773Freestanding bathtubs</a>

1774 are all the rave these days. Freestanding bathtubs add a modern or contemporary look to your bathroom, making it look sleek and updated. However, if you&rsquo;re going for an antique-looking freestanding tub, clawfoot bathtubs would be a great option.</p>

1775

1776

1777<p>

1778&nbsp;</p>

1779

1780

1781<h4>

1782<span style="font-size:18px;">

1783Whirlpool Bathtubs</span>

1784</h4>

1785

1786

1787<p>

1788A whirlpool bathtub is known for its jets that help relax and massage the muscles. So if you&rsquo;re looking for a relaxing bathing experience, this may be the tub for you.</p>

1789

1790

1791<p>

1792&nbsp;</p>

1793

1794

1795<h4>

1796<span style="font-size:18px;">

1797Walk-in Bathtubs</span>

1798</h4>

1799

1800

1801<p>

1802This type of tub is designed for those who have trouble getting in and out of a regular bathtub. Walk-in bathtubs have grab bars that help avoid hazards like slipping and falling. Seats are also commonly found in this type of bathtub because they take pressure off the legs. A walk-in bathtub is different because there is more vertical space in the tub instead of horizontal space.</p>

1803

1804

1805<p>

1806&nbsp;</p>

1807

1808

1809<h3>

1810Bathtub Materials</h3>

1811

1812

1813<p>

1814There are various materials that bathtubs are made out of, but we will cover three of the most common materials here. These materials include porcelain, fiberglass, and acrylic. It&rsquo;s essential to understand the characteristics of each material so that you know <a href="https://vevano.com/resource-center/how-to-clean-a-bathtub/">

1815how to clean your bathtub </a>

1816and how best to maintain it over time. For a deeper dive into bathtub materials, check out our <a href="https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-bathtub-materials/">

1817best bathtub materials</a>

1818 comparison article.</p>

1819

1820

1821<p>

1822&nbsp;</p>

1823

1824

1825<h4>

1826<span style="font-size:18px;">

1827Steel Bathtubs</span>

1828</h4>

1829

1830

1831<p>

1832Steel bathtubs are sometimes referred to as porcelain tubs because the steel is covered in porcelain enamel. (On a similar note, cast iron tubs are also typically covered in porcelain, which is why they are known as enameled cast iron tubs.) Steel tubs generally are well-protected by this porcelain enamel, which is both stain and scratch-resistant and easy to clean. However, steel tubs don&rsquo;t retain heat well and are prone to chipping if a heavy object falls on its surface.</p>

1833

1834

1835<p>

1836&nbsp;</p>

1837

1838

1839<h4>

1840<span style="font-size:18px;">

1841Cast Iron Bathtubs</span>

1842</h4>

1843

1844

1845<p>

1846Though one of the heaviest tubs you can buy, enameled cast iron tubs are incredibly durable, resistant to stains, scratches, and chips. Cast iron tubs are especially known for their excellent heat retention. With proper maintenance, your cast iron tub can last you for decades to come.</p>

1847

1848

1849<p>

1850&nbsp;</p>

1851

1852

1853<h4>

1854<span style="font-size:18px;">

1855Fiberglass Bathtubs</span>

1856</h4>

1857

1858

1859<p>

1860Fiberglass tubs are made from fiberglass-reinforced plastic molded into the shape of a bathtub. These tubs are coated with a layer of gelcoat resin, which provides a high-quality finish and makes the surface easy to clean. Fiberglass is also a lightweight material, making it easy to move and install your tub.</p>

1861

1862

1863<p>

1864However, due to the nature of this lightweight material, fiberglass is also one of the most brittle bathtub materials on the market, cracking often. As a result, fiberglass tubs are generally less expensive than porcelain and acrylic tubs. In addition, the use of standard cleaning products on fiberglass also tends to discolor the surface over time. So, although this is one of the least expensive bathtub materials, keep in mind the long-term cost of buying a fiberglass tub.</p>

1865

1866

1867<p>

1868&nbsp;</p>

1869

1870

1871<h4>

1872<span style="font-size:18px;">

1873Acrylic Bathtubs</span>

1874</h4>

1875

1876

1877<p>

1878Acrylic is a combination of materials like stabilizers, resins, and fillers. Acrylic is often reinforced with fiberglass, making it a bit pricier than fiberglass tubs but more durable. In addition, acrylic is a non-porous material, which means that it will not absorb any excess water in your bathtub, helping it to avoid cracking. This non-porous material also helps with heat retention, keeping the water in your tub warmer for longer.</p>

1879

1880

1881<p>

1882&nbsp;</p>

1883

1884

1885<h3>

1886Other Features to Consider</h3>

1887

1888

1889<p>

1890We&rsquo;ve talked about bathtubs&rsquo; sizes, shapes, and materials, but now it&rsquo;s time to cover a few other features that affect your bathtub. If you would like a bathtub with a bit more support for your back while relaxing, try out a bathtub with lumbar support. If you are looking for a spa-like tub, you can purchase a bathtub with jets or a heated surface. You will also want to decide with what material you would like to finish your bathtub. The most common finish is a high-gloss white finish.</p>

1891

1892

1893<p>

1894&nbsp;</p>

1895

1896

1897<h3>

1898Drain Stopper</h3>

1899

1900

1901<p>

1902Along with the features listed above, you&rsquo;ll want to think about the drain stopper you would like. There are five drain stoppers:</p>

1903

1904

1905<ul>

1906

1907 <li>

1908<strong>

1909Toe-Touch: </strong>

1910You can open and close the train with the touch of your toe</li>

1911

1912 <li>

1913<strong>

1914Push-Pull: </strong>

1915The traditional pull-up knob in the middle to push it down and pull it to open</li>

1916

1917 <li>

1918<strong>

1919Flip-It: </strong>

1920You flip a toggle that will open or close, and you move the toggle from side to side</li>

1921

1922 <li>

1923<strong>

1924Pop-Up: </strong>

1925An internal rod moves to raise or lower the stopper</li>

1926

1927 <li>

1928<strong>

1929Trip-Lever:</strong>

1930 An internal plunger stops water flow in the drain</li>

1931

1932</ul>

1933

1934

1935<p>

1936All of these drain stoppers are great options, so the one that you decide for your new tub will be up to you and your personal preference.</p>

1937

1938

1939<p>

1940&nbsp;</p>

1941

1942

1943<h3>

1944What&rsquo;s Best For You?</h3>

1945

1946

1947<p>

1948We know there&rsquo;s a lot to understand when learning about bathtubs, but it doesn&rsquo;t need to be overwhelming. Refer back to this as your guide when it comes to any questions about bathtubs. If you have additional questions, don&rsquo;t hesitate to contact our designers. You can consult with our virtual interior designers by calling 855.483.2629 or email us your questions at design@vevano.com. We&rsquo;d love to hear from you and help you with your bathroom remodeling!</p>

1949

1950</div>

1951</div>

1952</div>

1953</div>

1954</div>

1955</div>

1956</span>

1957</div>

1958</div>

1959</div>

1960</div>

1961</div>

1962</div>

1963</div>

\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eKohler Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n Visible"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}}],"elementId":"related-links-column","additionalClasses":"","backgroundColor":[{"value":"transparent","label":"Transparent (Default)"}],"customBackgroundColor":"#ffffff","useBackgroundImage":{"value":false,"label":"No"},"backgroundImage":"","parallax":{"value":true,"label":"Yes"},"margins":"0px","padding":"0px","textAlign":{"label":"None","value":"initial"},"border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","boxShadow":{"label":"None","value":"none"},"visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"hidden-xs animation"}},{"id":"ba238efb-c3a6-4d00-b77f-4196cdab5a09","type":"COLUMN","children":[{"id":"e24d1978-b29f-4e5f-8cee-d9026cef0f0c","type":"CODE_BLOCK","children":[],"codeSnippet":"\u003c!-- BATHTUBS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eBathtub Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eRoman Bathtub Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eAcrylic Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eKohler Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"related-links-mobile","additionalClasses":"","margins":"24px 0 0 0","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"visible-xs hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg","label":"Mobile Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"d197832a-f585-4323-846f-58d82f8d2b01","type":"TEXTBLOCK","children":[],"richText":{"css":"","html":"\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFind the Ideal Bathtub\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eVevano Home offers a wide selection of\u0026nbsp;high-quality, stylish bathtubs in various\u0026nbsp;sizes and materials. Whether you\u0026#39;re looking for a timeless cast iron freestanding tub or a sleek modern drop-in, we\u0026#39;ve got you covered. Not sure what tub is best for you? We can help with that too! Here\u0026#39;s everything you need to know about tub sizes, shapes, materials, and more\u0026nbsp;so you can find the ideal tub for your bathroom.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eBathtub Size\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s start with the size of your bathtub. Some may prefer an above-average length instead of a deeper soaking depth. If you are a tall person that enjoys laying back and relaxing in your tub, you may want to choose a length over depth. Bathtubs come in 4ft, 5ft, and 6ft lengths.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn the other hand, if you prefer to have a deeper bathtub, allowing you to emerge yourself in the water fully, you will probably want to prioritize depth over length. Some people also enjoy deeper tubs because their kids or pets can fit inside as well. A standard bathtub measures 14\u0026ndash;20 inches. Whatever you prefer, there is an option for you, and our guide on \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/standard-tub-size-measurement-guide/\"\u003ehow to measure a bathtub\u003c/a\u003e can help!\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eTypes of Bathtubs\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs you search for a new tub, it helps to understand the five main types of bathtubs\u0026mdash;drop-in, alcove, freestanding, whirlpool, and walk-in bathtubs. All of these bathtubs are very different and have unique features.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-drop-in-bathtubs/\"\u003eDrop-in Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis particular type of bathtub is your typical rectangular-shaped bathtub with angular lines. Drop-in bathtubs are tubs dropped in a frame or structure, featuring a rim that goes around the top of the tub. You can customize your drop-in bathtub by selecting the material you would like the rim to be made of; most people prefer tile or stone. These bathtubs are ideal for a children\u0026rsquo;s bathroom because of its shape and ease of getting in and out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-tubs-alcove-bathtubs/\"\u003eAlcove Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAn alcove bathtub is most known to be in the corner of a bathroom and is known for the way it is installed. These beautiful bathtubs are installed into a recess in a bathroom, often against a wall or in the corner. Since these tubs are designed to fit between three furnished walls, it\u0026rsquo;s not uncommon to see a shower curtain on the fourth wall. Alcove tubs and drop-in tubs are very similar; however, alcove tubs require fewer steps during installation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-freestanding-bathtubs/\"\u003eFreestanding Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-freestanding-tubs/\"\u003eFreestanding bathtubs\u003c/a\u003e are all the rave these days. Freestanding bathtubs add a modern or contemporary look to your bathroom, making it look sleek and updated. However, if you\u0026rsquo;re going for an antique-looking freestanding tub, clawfoot bathtubs would be a great option.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eWhirlpool Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA whirlpool bathtub is known for its jets that help relax and massage the muscles. So if you\u0026rsquo;re looking for a relaxing bathing experience, this may be the tub for you.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eWalk-in Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis type of tub is designed for those who have trouble getting in and out of a regular bathtub. Walk-in bathtubs have grab bars that help avoid hazards like slipping and falling. Seats are also commonly found in this type of bathtub because they take pressure off the legs. A walk-in bathtub is different because there is more vertical space in the tub instead of horizontal space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eBathtub Materials\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThere are various materials that bathtubs are made out of, but we will cover three of the most common materials here. These materials include porcelain, fiberglass, and acrylic. It\u0026rsquo;s essential to understand the characteristics of each material so that you know \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/how-to-clean-a-bathtub/\"\u003ehow to clean your bathtub \u003c/a\u003eand how best to maintain it over time. For a deeper dive into bathtub materials, check out our \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-bathtub-materials/\"\u003ebest bathtub materials\u003c/a\u003e comparison article.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eSteel Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSteel bathtubs are sometimes referred to as porcelain tubs because the steel is covered in porcelain enamel. (On a similar note, cast iron tubs are also typically covered in porcelain, which is why they are known as enameled cast iron tubs.) Steel tubs generally are well-protected by this porcelain enamel, which is both stain and scratch-resistant and easy to clean. However, steel tubs don\u0026rsquo;t retain heat well and are prone to chipping if a heavy object falls on its surface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eCast Iron Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThough one of the heaviest tubs you can buy, enameled cast iron tubs are incredibly durable, resistant to stains, scratches, and chips. Cast iron tubs are especially known for their excellent heat retention. With proper maintenance, your cast iron tub can last you for decades to come.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eFiberglass Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFiberglass tubs are made from fiberglass-reinforced plastic molded into the shape of a bathtub. These tubs are coated with a layer of gelcoat resin, which provides a high-quality finish and makes the surface easy to clean. Fiberglass is also a lightweight material, making it easy to move and install your tub.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, due to the nature of this lightweight material, fiberglass is also one of the most brittle bathtub materials on the market, cracking often. As a result, fiberglass tubs are generally less expensive than porcelain and acrylic tubs. In addition, the use of standard cleaning products on fiberglass also tends to discolor the surface over time. So, although this is one of the least expensive bathtub materials, keep in mind the long-term cost of buying a fiberglass tub.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eAcrylic Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAcrylic is a combination of materials like stabilizers, resins, and fillers. Acrylic is often reinforced with fiberglass, making it a bit pricier than fiberglass tubs but more durable. In addition, acrylic is a non-porous material, which means that it will not absorb any excess water in your bathtub, helping it to avoid cracking. This non-porous material also helps with heat retention, keeping the water in your tub warmer for longer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eOther Features to Consider\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe\u0026rsquo;ve talked about bathtubs\u0026rsquo; sizes, shapes, and materials, but now it\u0026rsquo;s time to cover a few other features that affect your bathtub. If you would like a bathtub with a bit more support for your back while relaxing, try out a bathtub with lumbar support. If you are looking for a spa-like tub, you can purchase a bathtub with jets or a heated surface. You will also want to decide with what material you would like to finish your bathtub. The most common finish is a high-gloss white finish.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eDrain Stopper\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlong with the features listed above, you\u0026rsquo;ll want to think about the drain stopper you would like. There are five drain stoppers:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eToe-Touch: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can open and close the train with the touch of your toe\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePush-Pull: \u003c/strong\u003eThe traditional pull-up knob in the middle to push it down and pull it to open\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFlip-It: \u003c/strong\u003eYou flip a toggle that will open or close, and you move the toggle from side to side\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePop-Up: \u003c/strong\u003eAn internal rod moves to raise or lower the stopper\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTrip-Lever:\u003c/strong\u003e An internal plunger stops water flow in the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll of these drain stoppers are great options, so the one that you decide for your new tub will be up to you and your personal preference.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat\u0026rsquo;s Best For You?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe know there\u0026rsquo;s a lot to understand when learning about bathtubs, but it doesn\u0026rsquo;t need to be overwhelming. Refer back to this as your guide when it comes to any questions about bathtubs. If you have additional questions, don\u0026rsquo;t hesitate to contact our designers. You can consult with our virtual interior designers by calling 855.483.2629 or email us your questions at design@vevano.com. We\u0026rsquo;d love to hear from you and help you with your bathroom remodeling!\u003c/p\u003e\n"},"elementId":"","additionalClasses":"","margins":"0px","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always BATHTUBS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eBathtub Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eBathtub Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eRoman Bathtub Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eAcrylic Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eKohler Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"related-links-mobile","additionalClasses":"","margins":"24px 0 0 0","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"visible-xs hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg","label":"Mobile Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"d197832a-f585-4323-846f-58d82f8d2b01","type":"TEXTBLOCK","children":[],"richText":{"css":"","html":"\u003ch2\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFind the Ideal Bathtub\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eVevano Home offers a wide selection of\u0026nbsp;high-quality, stylish bathtubs in various\u0026nbsp;sizes and materials. Whether you\u0026#39;re looking for a timeless cast iron freestanding tub or a sleek modern drop-in, we\u0026#39;ve got you covered. Not sure what tub is best for you? We can help with that too! Here\u0026#39;s everything you need to know about tub sizes, shapes, materials, and more\u0026nbsp;so you can find the ideal tub for your bathroom.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eBathtub Size\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s start with the size of your bathtub. Some may prefer an above-average length instead of a deeper soaking depth. If you are a tall person that enjoys laying back and relaxing in your tub, you may want to choose a length over depth. Bathtubs come in 4ft, 5ft, and 6ft lengths.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn the other hand, if you prefer to have a deeper bathtub, allowing you to emerge yourself in the water fully, you will probably want to prioritize depth over length. Some people also enjoy deeper tubs because their kids or pets can fit inside as well. A standard bathtub measures 14\u0026ndash;20 inches. Whatever you prefer, there is an option for you, and our guide on \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/standard-tub-size-measurement-guide/\"\u003ehow to measure a bathtub\u003c/a\u003e can help!\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eTypes of Bathtubs\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs you search for a new tub, it helps to understand the five main types of bathtubs\u0026mdash;drop-in, alcove, freestanding, whirlpool, and walk-in bathtubs. All of these bathtubs are very different and have unique features.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-drop-in-bathtubs/\"\u003eDrop-in Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis particular type of bathtub is your typical rectangular-shaped bathtub with angular lines. Drop-in bathtubs are tubs dropped in a frame or structure, featuring a rim that goes around the top of the tub. You can customize your drop-in bathtub by selecting the material you would like the rim to be made of; most people prefer tile or stone. These bathtubs are ideal for a children\u0026rsquo;s bathroom because of its shape and ease of getting in and out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-tubs-alcove-bathtubs/\"\u003eAlcove Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAn alcove bathtub is most known to be in the corner of a bathroom and is known for the way it is installed. These beautiful bathtubs are installed into a recess in a bathroom, often against a wall or in the corner. Since these tubs are designed to fit between three furnished walls, it\u0026rsquo;s not uncommon to see a shower curtain on the fourth wall. Alcove tubs and drop-in tubs are very similar; however, alcove tubs require fewer steps during installation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/showers-and-tubs-freestanding-bathtubs/\"\u003eFreestanding Bathtub\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-freestanding-tubs/\"\u003eFreestanding bathtubs\u003c/a\u003e are all the rave these days. Freestanding bathtubs add a modern or contemporary look to your bathroom, making it look sleek and updated. However, if you\u0026rsquo;re going for an antique-looking freestanding tub, clawfoot bathtubs would be a great option.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eWhirlpool Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA whirlpool bathtub is known for its jets that help relax and massage the muscles. So if you\u0026rsquo;re looking for a relaxing bathing experience, this may be the tub for you.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eWalk-in Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis type of tub is designed for those who have trouble getting in and out of a regular bathtub. Walk-in bathtubs have grab bars that help avoid hazards like slipping and falling. Seats are also commonly found in this type of bathtub because they take pressure off the legs. A walk-in bathtub is different because there is more vertical space in the tub instead of horizontal space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eBathtub Materials\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThere are various materials that bathtubs are made out of, but we will cover three of the most common materials here. These materials include porcelain, fiberglass, and acrylic. It\u0026rsquo;s essential to understand the characteristics of each material so that you know \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/how-to-clean-a-bathtub/\"\u003ehow to clean your bathtub \u003c/a\u003eand how best to maintain it over time. For a deeper dive into bathtub materials, check out our \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/resource-center/best-bathtub-materials/\"\u003ebest bathtub materials\u003c/a\u003e comparison article.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eSteel Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSteel bathtubs are sometimes referred to as porcelain tubs because the steel is covered in porcelain enamel. (On a similar note, cast iron tubs are also typically covered in porcelain, which is why they are known as enameled cast iron tubs.) Steel tubs generally are well-protected by this porcelain enamel, which is both stain and scratch-resistant and easy to clean. However, steel tubs don\u0026rsquo;t retain heat well and are prone to chipping if a heavy object falls on its surface.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eCast Iron Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThough one of the heaviest tubs you can buy, enameled cast iron tubs are incredibly durable, resistant to stains, scratches, and chips. Cast iron tubs are especially known for their excellent heat retention. With proper maintenance, your cast iron tub can last you for decades to come.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eFiberglass Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFiberglass tubs are made from fiberglass-reinforced plastic molded into the shape of a bathtub. These tubs are coated with a layer of gelcoat resin, which provides a high-quality finish and makes the surface easy to clean. Fiberglass is also a lightweight material, making it easy to move and install your tub.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, due to the nature of this lightweight material, fiberglass is also one of the most brittle bathtub materials on the market, cracking often. As a result, fiberglass tubs are generally less expensive than porcelain and acrylic tubs. In addition, the use of standard cleaning products on fiberglass also tends to discolor the surface over time. So, although this is one of the least expensive bathtub materials, keep in mind the long-term cost of buying a fiberglass tub.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-size:18px;\"\u003eAcrylic Bathtubs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAcrylic is a combination of materials like stabilizers, resins, and fillers. Acrylic is often reinforced with fiberglass, making it a bit pricier than fiberglass tubs but more durable. In addition, acrylic is a non-porous material, which means that it will not absorb any excess water in your bathtub, helping it to avoid cracking. This non-porous material also helps with heat retention, keeping the water in your tub warmer for longer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eOther Features to Consider\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe\u0026rsquo;ve talked about bathtubs\u0026rsquo; sizes, shapes, and materials, but now it\u0026rsquo;s time to cover a few other features that affect your bathtub. If you would like a bathtub with a bit more support for your back while relaxing, try out a bathtub with lumbar support. If you are looking for a spa-like tub, you can purchase a bathtub with jets or a heated surface. You will also want to decide with what material you would like to finish your bathtub. The most common finish is a high-gloss white finish.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eDrain Stopper\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlong with the features listed above, you\u0026rsquo;ll want to think about the drain stopper you would like. There are five drain stoppers:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eToe-Touch: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can open and close the train with the touch of your toe\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePush-Pull: \u003c/strong\u003eThe traditional pull-up knob in the middle to push it down and pull it to open\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFlip-It: \u003c/strong\u003eYou flip a toggle that will open or close, and you move the toggle from side to side\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePop-Up: \u003c/strong\u003eAn internal rod moves to raise or lower the stopper\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTrip-Lever:\u003c/strong\u003e An internal plunger stops water flow in the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAll of these drain stoppers are great options, so the one that you decide for your new tub will be up to you and your personal preference.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat\u0026rsquo;s Best For You?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe know there\u0026rsquo;s a lot to understand when learning about bathtubs, but it doesn\u0026rsquo;t need to be overwhelming. Refer back to this as your guide when it comes to any questions about bathtubs. If you have additional questions, don\u0026rsquo;t hesitate to contact our designers. You can consult with our virtual interior designers by calling 855.483.2629 or email us your questions at design@vevano.com. We\u0026rsquo;d love to hear from you and help you with your bathroom remodeling!\u003c/p\u003e\n"},"elementId":"","additionalClasses":"","margins":"0px","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always
